<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>19.4.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Irreparable Harm</B>. [ * * * ] acknowledges that, in the event it breaches (or attempts or threatens to breach) its obligation to [ * * * ] in accordance with this
Agreement, its obligation respecting [ * * * ] in accordance with [ * * * ], or its obligation to provide [ * * * ] in accordance with [ * * * ], [ * * * ] and/or [ * * * ] will be irreparably harmed.&nbsp;[ * * * ] acknowledgement is based on its
reliance on [ * * * ] representation that it would only utilize the provisions of this <B><U>Section&nbsp;19.4.2</U></B> when it has a good faith belief that it needs to obtain injunctive relief as quickly as possible to avoid an adverse impact on
the ability of [ * * * ] to conduct any segment of its business which would be prevented or unreasonably disrupted in the event [ * * * ] denies, withdraws or restricts its [ * * * ] to [ * * * ] or withholds [ * * * ] access to [ * * * ].&nbsp;In
such a circumstance, [ * * * ] may proceed directly to court. If a court of competent jurisdiction should find that [ * * * ] has breached (or attempted or threatened to breach) any such obligations, [ * * * ] agrees that without any additional
findings of irreparable injury or other conditions to injunctive relief, [ * * * ] shall be entitled to seek and obtain injunctive relief, including&nbsp;entry of an appropriate order compelling performance by [ * * * ] and restraining it from any
further breaches (or attempted or threatened breaches). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Attorney&#146;s Fees</B>. A Party filing a pleading seeking immediate injunctive relief, which is not awarded in substantial part, shall pay all reasonable costs and
attorneys' fees of the other Party. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Jurisdiction. </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each Party irrevocably
agrees that any legal action, suit or proceeding brought by it in any way arising out of this Agreement must be brought solely and exclusively in Illinois, and each Party irrevocably submits to the sole and exclusive jurisdiction of the federal and
state courts in Cook County, Illinois, <I>in personam</I>, generally and unconditionally with respect to any action, suit or proceeding brought by it or against it by the other Party. </FONT></P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>19.6</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Continued Performance</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>19.6.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>General</B>. Subject to <B><U>Section&nbsp;19.6.2</U></B>, each Party agrees that it shall, unless otherwise directed by the other Party, continue performing its
obligations under this Agreement while any dispute is being resolved; provided, that this provision shall not operate or be construed as extending the Term of this Agreement or prohibiting or delaying a Party&#146;s exercise of any right it may have
to terminate the Term as to all or any part of the Services. For purposes of clarification, Kraft Data may not be withheld by Supplier pending the resolution of any dispute. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>19.6.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Non-Interruption of Service</B>. Supplier acknowledges and agrees that any interruption to the Service may cause irreparable harm to Kraft and/or the Eligible
Recipients, in which case an adequate remedy at law would not be available. Subject to Supplier&#146;s right to terminate the Term pursuant to <B><U>Section&nbsp;20.1.2</U></B>, Supplier expressly acknowledges and agrees that, pending resolution of
any dispute or controversy, it shall not deny, withdraw or restrict Supplier&#146;s provision of the Services to Kraft and/or the Eligible Recipients under this Agreement, except as specifically and expressly agreed in writing by Kraft and Supplier.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>19.7</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Governing Law</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Agreement and
performance under it shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the applicable laws of the State of Illinois, without giving effect to the principles thereof relating to conflicts of laws. The application of the United Nations Convention
on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods is expressly excluded. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>19.8</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Expiration of Claims. </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Without altering
either Party's rights or obligations under <B><U>Section 12.1.4</U></B>, no claims to be resolved under this <B><U>Article 19</U></B> may be asserted by either Party more than four (4)&nbsp;years after the later of (i)&nbsp;the last date on which
the act or omission giving rise to the claim occurred, or (ii)&nbsp;with respect to invoices issued under this Agreement, the date on which such act or omission was discovered or should reasonably have been discovered (the election to conduct or not
to conduct an audit with respect to an invoice shall not, in and of itself, be evidence of reasonableness for this purpose); provided, however, that the foregoing shall not apply to claims based upon a Party&#146;s fraud or willful misconduct, or a
claim for which a Party has an indemnity obligation under this Agreement in which event the applicable statute of limitations shall apply. Failure to make such a claim (but not including claims referred to in the <I>proviso </I>of the preceding
sentence) within such four-year period shall forever bar the claim. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>20.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>TERMINATION </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>20.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Termination for Cause. </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If Supplier: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">commits a material breach of its obligations with respect to Transition Services as provided in <B><U>Section&nbsp;4.2.7</U></B>; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">commits a material breach of this Agreement or an applicable Supplement, which breach is not cured within 30 days after notice of the breach from
Kraft; provided </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">139

that if Supplier works diligently and in good faith to cure such breach in accordance with this provision and such breach is not capable of being cured within 30 days, Supplier may have up to 15
additional days to cure such breach if it demonstrates that it is capable of curing such breach within the additional period and the breach does not materially impair the ability of Kraft or an Eligible Recipient to conduct its business;

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">commits [ * * * ] of its duties or obligations of which Supplier has [ * * * ] and which [ * * * ] of this Agreement or an applicable Supplement, and fails to
(A)&nbsp;cure such breaches within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after receiving notice from the time such breaches become a material breach, and (B)&nbsp;give Kraft adequate assurance that the cause of each of such breaches has been corrected so as not to
be repeated again; provided, however that if, within the twelve (12)&nbsp;month period following the thirty (30)&nbsp;day period described in the preceding clause (A), Supplier again commits numerous breaches of its duties or obligations of which
Supplier has received notice and which collectively constitute a material breach of this Agreement, Supplier shall not be entitled to the cure rights described in the preceding clauses (A)&nbsp;and (B); </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

than [ * * * ] of the At Risk Amount for that month; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">then Kraft may, by giving notice to Supplier, terminate the term of this Agreement or the Term of an applicable Supplement with respect to all or any part of the Services, as of a date specified in the
notice of termination. Supplier shall not be entitled to any Termination Charges in connection with such a termination for cause. If Kraft chooses to terminate this Agreement or a Supplement in part, the Charges payable under this Agreement or such
Supplement will be equitably adjusted in accordance with the pricing methodology set forth in the applicable Supplement, to reflect such partial termination. For avoidance of doubt, the Parties acknowledge and agree that a material breach under a
Supplement shall be deemed a material breach under all Supplements for purposes of this provision. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

which it has cured the breach that gave rise to Kraft's termination right pursuant to <B><U>Section&nbsp;20.1.1.1</U></B>, and (ii)&nbsp;the date that Supplier has provided written notification that it has cured the breach. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>By Supplier</B>. In the event that Kraft fails to pay Supplier undisputed charges exceeding in the aggregate [ * * * ], or Kraft fails to place disputed amounts into
escrow to the extent required by <B><U>Section&nbsp;12.4.6</U></B>, by the specified due date and fails to cure such default within 30 days after Kraft&#146;s Chief Information Officer receives a notice from Supplier of such failure and
Supplier&#146;s intention to terminate for failure to make such payment, Supplier may, by notice to Kraft, terminate the Term. Supplier acknowledges and agrees that <B><U>Sections 20.1.2</U></B> and <B><U>20.5</U></B> describe Supplier&#146;s sole
right to terminate this Agreement or a Supplement and Supplier hereby waives any other rights it may have to terminate this Agreement or any Supplement under this Agreement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Termination for Convenience</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Beginning [
* * * ] months after the Commencement Date of a Supplement, Kraft may terminate such Supplement, in whole or in part, with respect to all or any portion of the Services under such Supplement for convenience and without cause with effect at any time
by giving Supplier at least three months&#146; prior notice designating the termination date. If Kraft elects to terminate on this basis, Kraft shall pay to Supplier a Termination Charge calculated in accordance with the applicable Supplement. In
the event that a purported termination for cause by Kraft under <B><U>Section&nbsp;20.1</U></B> is determined by a competent authority not to be properly a termination for cause, then such termination by Kraft shall be deemed to be a termination for
convenience under this <B><U>Section&nbsp;20.2</U></B>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the event of a change in Control of Supplier (or that portion of Supplier providing all or any material portion of the Services under this Agreement) or the Entity that Controls Supplier (if any),
where such control is acquired, directly or indirectly, in a single transaction or series of related transactions, or all or substantially all of the assets of Supplier (or that portion of Supplier providing all or any material portion of the
Services under this Agreement) are acquired by any entity, or Supplier (or that portion of Supplier providing all or any material portion of the Services under this Agreement) is merged with or into another entity to form a new entity, then at any
time within 12 months after the last to occur of such events, Kraft may at its option terminate the Term by giving Supplier at least 90 days&#146; prior notice and designating a date upon which such termination shall be effective; provided, however,
if such change in Control of Supplier involves a [ * * * ], Kraft may terminate the Term by giving Supplier at least 60 days&#146; prior notice, and such [ * * * ] shall be prohibited from any contact with Kraft Data, Kraft Proprietary Information
and any and all other information about the Kraft account, including discussions with Supplier Personnel regarding specifics relating to the Services. Supplier shall be entitled to [ * * * ], calculated in accordance with the applicable Supplement,
in connection with a termination on this basis. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>20.5</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Termination for Insolvency</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the event
that any Party (i)&nbsp;commences a bankruptcy case or a bankruptcy case is commenced against a Party, (ii)&nbsp;becomes or is declared insolvent, is the subject of insolvency or similar proceedings under state or federal law, or a receiver or
similar officer or representative is appointed with respect to all or substantially all of a Party&#146;s assets, (iii)&nbsp;passes a resolution for its voluntary liquidation, (iv)&nbsp;makes an assignment for the benefit of all or substantially all
of its creditors, (v)&nbsp;enters into an agreement or arrangement for the composition, extension, or readjustment of substantially all of its obligations , or (vi)&nbsp;experiences an event analogous to any of the foregoing in any jurisdiction in
which any of its assets are situated, then the other Party may terminate this Agreement as of a date specified in a termination notice; provided, however, that Supplier will not have the right to exercise such termination under this Section so long
as Kraft pays for the Services to be received hereunder in advance on a month-to-month basis. If any Party elects to terminate this Agreement due to the insolvency of the other Party, such termination will be deemed to be a termination for cause
hereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>General Rights</B>. In the event of [ * * * ] bankruptcy or other formal procedure referenced in <B><U>Section&nbsp;20.5</U></B> or of the filing of any petition
under bankruptcy laws affecting the rights of [ * * * ] which is not stayed or dismissed within [ * * * ] days of filing, in addition to the other rights and remedies set forth herein, to the maximum extent permitted by Law, subject to the
qualifications in the last two sentences below, [ * * * ] will have the right to retain and take possession for safekeeping all [ * * * ] to which [ * * * ] and/or [ * * * ] are or would be entitled during the Term or upon the expiration or
termination of this Agreement. [ * * * ] shall cooperate fully with [ * * * ] and [ * * * ] and assist [ * * * ] and [ * * * ] in identifying and taking possession of the items listed in the preceding sentence. [ * * * ] shall comply with [ * * * ]
reasonable safety and security procedures, shall not have a right to access data or materials which it would not have a right to obtain under the provisions of this Agreement, and shall use reasonable efforts to avoid disruptions to [ * * * ]
operations. [ * * * ] shall be excused of any failure or inability to perform [ * * * ] in accordance with this Agreement to the extent caused by [ * * * ] actions. [ * * * ] will have the right to hold such [ * * * ] until such time as the trustee
or receiver in bankruptcy or other appropriate insolvency office holder can provide adequate assurances and evidence to [ * * * ] that they will be protected from sale, release, inspection, publication, or inclusion in any publicly accessible
record, document, material or filing. [ * * * ] acknowledges that [ * * * ] has stated that without this material provision, [ * * * ] would not have entered into this Agreement or provided any right to the possession or use of [ * * * ] Agreement.
[ * * * ] may not use its rights under this section to effect [ * * * ], nor will [ * * * ] exercise of its rights hereunder alter in any manner the pricing under the applicable Supplement. To the extent [ * * * ] removal of any such [ * * * ]
impairs [ * * * ] ability to perform, [ * * * ] shall be excused pursuant to [ * * * ], provided that [ * * * ] shall retain all rights it would otherwise have under this Agreement [ * * * ] subject to the [ * * * ] under the applicable Supplement.

becomes a debtor under the United States Bankruptcy Code (11 U.S.C. &#167;101 et. seq. or any similar Law in any other country (the &#147;<B>Bankruptcy Code</B>&#148;)) and rejects this Agreement pursuant to Section&nbsp;365 of the Bankruptcy

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
Code (a &#147;<B>Bankruptcy Rejection</B>&#148;), (i)&nbsp;any and all of the licensee and sublicensee rights, to the extent such rights are &#147;intellectual property rights&#148;, of Kraft and
the Eligible Recipients arising under or otherwise set forth in this Agreement, including without limitation the rights of Kraft and/or the Eligible Recipients referred to in <B><U>Section&nbsp;14.6</U></B>, shall be deemed, upon election by Kraft
under Section&nbsp;365(n)(1)(b) of the Bankruptcy Code, fully retained by and vested in Kraft and/or the Eligible Recipients as protected intellectual property rights under Section&nbsp;365(n)(1)(B) of the Bankruptcy Code and further shall be deemed
to exist immediately before the commencement of the bankruptcy case in which Supplier is the debtor; (ii)&nbsp;Kraft shall have all of the rights afforded to non-debtor licensees and sublicensees under Section&nbsp;365(n) of the Bankruptcy Code; and
(iii)&nbsp;to the extent any license or sublicense rights of Kraft and/or the Eligible Recipients under this Agreement which arise after the termination or expiration of this Agreement are determined by a bankruptcy court not to be
&#147;intellectual property rights&#148; for purposes of Section&nbsp;365(n), all of such license or sublicense rights shall remain vested in and fully retained by Kraft and/or the Eligible Recipients to the extent provided in this Agreement after
any Bankruptcy Rejection as though this Agreement were terminated or expired in accordance with its terms. Kraft shall under no circumstances be required to terminate this Agreement after a Bankruptcy Rejection in order to enjoy or acquire any of
its rights under this Agreement, including without limitation any of the rights of Kraft referenced in <B><U>Section&nbsp;14.6</U></B>, unless termination of this Agreement or a Supplement by Kraft is required under the terms of the Agreement for
Kraft to enjoy or acquire any such rights. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>20.7</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Critical Services</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Without limiting
Kraft&#146;s rights under <B><U>Section&nbsp;20.1</U></B>, if Supplier commits a material breach which has a significant impact on the ability of Kraft or the Eligible Recipients to conduct a material aspect of their businesses, and Supplier is
unable to cure such breach within [ * * * ], Kraft may, in addition to its other remedies at law and in equity, obtain from a third party or provide for itself services which will allow Kraft or the Eligible Recipients to conduct their businesses
until Supplier has cured the breach or this Agreement is terminated. Supplier shall reimburse Kraft for all costs and expenses of obtaining or providing such services, at Kraft&#146;s election, for up to six (6)&nbsp;[ * * * ] after Supplier has
notified Kraft in writing that Supplier will be unable to resume performance of the affected Services, which notice may not be given until after the commencement of the breach. The express inclusion of this remedy in this
<B><U>Section&nbsp;20.7</U></B> does not limit Kraft&#146;s right to use a similar remedy for other breaches by Supplier of this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>21.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>GENERAL </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Binding Nature and Assignment</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Binding Nature</B>. This Agreement will be binding on the Parties and their respective successors and permitted assigns. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Assignment</B>. Neither Party may, or will have the power to, assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other, except in the following
circumstances: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Kraft may assign its rights or obligations under this Agreement, in whole or in part, without approval of Supplier, to an Affiliate which expressly
assumes Kraft&#146;s obligations and responsibilities hereunder, provided Kraft (i)&nbsp;remains fully liable for and is not relieved from the full performance of its obligations
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">143

under this Agreement, and (ii)&nbsp;provides Supplier prompt written notice of the assignment; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

Control of Kraft, an Entity into which Kraft is merged, or an Entity acquiring all or substantially all of Kraft&#146;s assets, provided the acquirer or surviving Entity agrees in writing to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

assignment. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

Agreement, including any Supplements, Schedules and Exhibits referred to herein and attached hereto, each of which is incorporated herein for all purposes, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter
hereof. There are no agreements, representations, warranties, promises, covenants, commitments or undertakings other than those expressly set forth herein. This Agreement supersedes all prior agreements, representations, warranties, promises,
covenants, commitments or undertaking, whether written or oral, with respect to the subject matter contained in this Agreement. No amendment, modification, change, waiver or discharge hereof shall be valid unless in writing and signed by an
authorized representative of the Party against which such amendment, modification, change, waiver, or discharge is sought to be enforced. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

specified in <B><U>Section&nbsp;21.3.1</U></B>, may be sent in </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

or the Eligible Recipients and has no right, power or authority, expressly or impliedly, to represent or bind Kraft or the Eligible Recipients as to any matters, except as expressly authorized in this Agreement. </FONT></P>

to reflect as nearly as possible the original intentions of the Parties in accordance with applicable law. The remaining provisions of this Agreement and the application of the challenged provision to persons or circumstances other than those as to
which it is invalid or unenforceable shall not be affected thereby, and each such provision shall be valid and enforceable to the full extent permitted by law. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

Party at law, in equity or otherwise. The election by a Party of any remedy provided for in this Agreement or otherwise available to such Party shall not preclude such Party from pursuing any other remedies available to such Party at law, in equity,
by contract or otherwise. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
export from the United States under any classification other than EAR99. Supplier will be the importer of record of any items for which import is required for delivery of any portion of the
Services outside the United States and for maintaining such records as may be necessary or required as importer to comply with such Laws unless, (1)&nbsp;at Kraft&#146;s option, which may be exercised on a case by case basis, Kraft notifies Service
Provider that Kraft will be the importer of record or (2)&nbsp;Supplier is not able to be the importer of record (such as where Supplier does not have a legal entity in place, or does not own the equipment being shipped) and Kraft can be the
importer of record. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>21.14</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Enforcement and Third Party Beneficiaries</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Kraft shall have the right to enforce this Agreement and to assert all rights and exercise and receive the benefits of all remedies, including monetary
damages, on behalf of each Eligible Recipient to the same extent as if such Eligible Recipient were Kraft under this Agreement. Except as expressly provided herein, this Agreement is entered into solely between, and may be enforced only by, Kraft
(on behalf of itself and the other Eligible Recipients) and Supplier (on behalf of itself and the Supplier Affiliates). Except as expressly provided herein, this Agreement shall not be deemed to create any rights or causes of action in or on behalf
of any third parties, including without limitation employees, suppliers and customers of a Party, or to create any obligations of a Party to any such third parties. Kraft is responsible for: (i)&nbsp;causing each Eligible Recipient to comply with
the provisions of this Agreement where to the extent that Supplier performs the Services for Eligible Recipients, and (ii)&nbsp;payment of all of Supplier&#146;s Charges hereunder (including those that may be invoiced to an Eligible Recipient).
Supplier shall first look to the Eligible Recipient that has been invoiced for payment under such invoice, provided that Kraft will be responsible for payment should the Eligible Recipient fail to pay such amounts when due. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Covenant Regarding Pledging</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Supplier
may assign, transfer, pledge, hypothecate or otherwise encumber its rights to receive payments from Kraft under this Agreement, provided that Supplier shall ensure that (a)&nbsp;no Entity to which Supplier assigns, transfers, pledges, hypothecates
or otherwise encumbers its rights to receive payments hereunder shall have any right to enforce the terms of this Agreement, except for its right to collect such payments from Kraft or the Eligible Recipients in accordance with the terms and
conditions of this Agreement, (b)&nbsp;any Entity to which Supplier assigns, transfers, pledges, hypothecates or otherwise encumbers its rights to receive payments hereunder shall not be entitled to approve any amendment, modification or termination
of this Agreement, (c)&nbsp;any such transaction shall not limit Supplier&#146;s rights to amend, modify or terminate this Agreement in accordance with the terms hereof and (d)&nbsp;Supplier shall continue to be Kraft&#146;s sole point of contact
with respect to this Agreement, including with respect to payment, subject to a third party&#146;s right to collect payment owed hereunder as provided above.&nbsp;The person or Entity to which such rights are assigned, transferred, pledged,
hypothecated or otherwise encumbered shall only be able to exercise the collection right referenced in clause (a)&nbsp;above if Kraft fails to pay Supplier for amounts due hereunder, other than amounts disputed by Kraft pursuant to
<B><U>Section&nbsp;12.4 </U></B>(including amounts where the dispute has been resolved through the dispute resolution process described in <B><U>Article 19</U></B>). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>21.16</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Order of Precedence</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the event of a
conflict, this amended MPSA shall take precedence over (a)&nbsp;the Schedules, and the Schedules shall take precedence over any Attachments or attached Exhibits, and (b)&nbsp;any Supplement, and Supplements shall take precedence over the Schedules,
Attachments and Exhibits to such Supplement, except for any term specifically identified as superseding the terms of this Agreement, which term shall control over this Agreement for that Supplement, Attachment or Exhibit only.. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">149
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT HAS BEEN REQUESTED FOR PORTIONS OF THIS EXHIBIT. THE COPY FILED HEREWITH OMITS THE INFORMATION SUBJECT
TO A CONFIDENTIALITY REQUEST. OMISSIONS ARE DESIGNATED [ * * * ]. A COMPLETE VERSION OF THIS EXHIBIT HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION. </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>21.17</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Hiring of Employees</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>21.17.1</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Solicitation and Hiring</B>. Except as expressly set forth herein, during the Term and for a period of 12 months thereafter, Supplier will not solicit for employment
directly or indirectly, nor employ, any employees of Kraft or an Eligible Recipient or individual Kraft Third Party Contractors involved in the performance or consumption of the Services, or who become known to the Supplier in connection with
Supplier&#146;s performance of the Services (unless Supplier is not aware and should not have been reasonably expected to be aware that the employer of the individual is a Kraft Third Party Contractor) without the prior approval of Kraft. Except as
expressly set forth herein in connection with the expiration or termination of this Agreement, during the Term and for a period of 12 months thereafter, Kraft will not, and will not permit any Kraft Affiliate to, solicit for employment directly or
indirectly, nor employ, any employee of Supplier involved in the performance of Supplier&#146;s obligations under a Supplement without the prior consent of Supplier. In each case, the prohibition on solicitation and hiring shall extend 90 days after
the termination of the employee&#146;s employment or, in the case of Supplier employees, the cessation of his or her involvement in the performance of Services under the applicable Supplement. This provision shall not operate or be construed to
prevent or limit any employee&#146;s right to practice his or her profession or to utilize his or her skills for another employer or to restrict any employee&#146;s freedom of movement or association. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>21.17.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Publications</B>. Neither the publication of classified advertisements in newspapers, periodicals, Internet bulletin boards, or other publications of general
availability or circulation nor the consideration and hiring of persons responding to such advertisements shall be deemed a breach of this <B><U>Section&nbsp;21.17</U></B>, unless the advertisement and solicitation is undertaken as a means to
circumvent or conceal a violation of this provision and/or the hiring party acts with knowledge of this hiring prohibition. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>21.18</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Further Assurances</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each Party covenants
and agrees that, subsequent to the execution and delivery of this Agreement and without any additional consideration, each Party shall execute and deliver any further legal instruments and perform any acts that are or may become necessary to
effectuate the purposes of this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>21.19</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Liens</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Other than judgment liens that
Supplier has obtained in a court of competent jurisdiction, Supplier will not file, or by its action or inaction permit, any liens to be filed on or against property or realty of Kraft or any Eligible Recipient. In the event that any such liens
arise as a result of Supplier&#146;s action or inaction, Supplier will obtain a bond to fully satisfy such liens or otherwise remove such liens (other than judgment liens mentioned in the previous sentence) at its sole cost and expense within 10
business days. If Supplier fails to do so, Kraft may, in its sole discretion, pay the amount of such lien, and/or deduct such amounts from payments due to the Supplier. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>21.20</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Covenant of Good Faith</B>. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each Party
agrees that, in its respective dealings with the other Party under or in connection with this Agreement, it shall act in good faith. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">150

executives of the Parties shall meet to discuss [ * * * ] condition and its ability to continue to perform its obligations hereunder. For the purposes of this <B><U>Section&nbsp;21.21</U></B>, &#147;[ * * * ]&#148; means (1)&nbsp;any [ * * * ] of

the GroceryCo Start Date, Supplier will not have any obligation to perform under this Agreement: (i)&nbsp;any of the Services that are not covered by this Agreement (which includes any Supplement or other associated document under this Agreement);
(ii)&nbsp;any of the Services under a Supplement to this Agreement that has been assigned or novated to GroceryCo to reside under the GroceryCo MPSA; or (iii)&nbsp;any of the Services under that certain Supplement A (for hosting services) to the
GroceryCo MPSA; provided that neither clause (ii)&nbsp;nor clause (iii)&nbsp;will relieve Supplier from its obligations to perform Services under this Agreement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">S-1

TO A CONFIDENTIALITY REQUEST. OMISSIONS ARE DESIGNATED [ * * * ]. A COMPLETE VERSION OF THIS EXHIBIT HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION. </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>SCHEDULE 1 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>DEFINITIONS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">References to the preamble, articles, sections, schedules and exhibits in
this <B><U>Schedule 1</U></B> are to the preamble, Articles and Sections of, and Schedules and Exhibits to, the Agreement unless otherwise specified. As used in this Agreement: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Acceptance</B>&#148; shall mean the determination, in Kraft&#146;s sole reasonable discretion, following implementation, installation, testing and execution in the production environment for an
agreed upon number of business cycles that Software, Equipment, Systems and/or other contract deliverables are in Compliance in all material respects with the Specifications. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Acquired Assets Credit</B>&#148; shall mean the amount (if any) set forth on the applicable Supplement that Supplier will pay to Kraft as consideration for the Acquired Assets. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Acquired Assets</B>&#148; shall mean the Equipment, Software and other assets (if any) owned or controlled by Kraft or the Eligible Recipients
and listed on the applicable Supplement that Supplier will acquire pursuant to the terms of this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Actual Uptime</B>&#148;
shall mean shall mean the measurement of time that a particular System, Application, Software, Equipment, Network or any other part of the Services is actually available during the Measurement Window, and such measurement will be calculated by
subtracting Downtime from the Scheduled Uptime. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Actual Volumes</B>&#148; means, for each Resource Unit during each applicable
measurement period, the actual volume of that Resource Unit measured for that period in accordance with the applicable Supplement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Additional Resource Charge(s)</B>&#148; or &#147;<B>ARC(s)</B>&#148; means, for any Billable Resource Unit, the incremental charge payable by
Kraft to Supplier based on the amount by which the Actual Volume of such Billable Resource Unit exceeds the Resource Baseline for such Billable Resource Unit. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Affected Contractors</B>&#148; means the Affected Personnel who are contractors. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Affected Kraft Foods Global Personnel</B>&#148; means the Kraft Personnel who are identified in the applicable Supplement, including all of the
individuals listed in the applicable Supplement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Affected Personnel</B>&#148; means the Affected Kraft Foods Global Personnel
&#147;<B>Affiliate</B>&#148; shall mean with respect to any Entity, any other Entity that directly or indirectly Controls, is Controlled by or under common Control with such Entity at the time in question. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Agreement</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in the preamble to this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>AICPA Auditors</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <B><U>Section&nbsp;9.10.9.1</U></B>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Allocation of Pool Percentage</B>&#148; shall mean the portion of the Pool Percentage Available for Allocation that is specified for a Performance Category. The total of all Allocation of Pool
Percentages shall not exceed the Pool Percentage Available for Allocation. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1 </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT HAS BEEN REQUESTED FOR PORTIONS OF THIS EXHIBIT. THE COPY FILED HEREWITH OMITS THE INFORMATION SUBJECT TO A
CONFIDENTIALITY REQUEST. OMISSIONS ARE DESIGNATED [ * * * ]. A COMPLETE VERSION OF THIS EXHIBIT HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION. </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I></I></B>&#147;<B><I></I></B><B>Altria</B><B><I></I></B>&#148; shall mean Altria Group, Inc., a
Virginia corporation with its principal place of business at 120 Park Avenue, New York, New York 10017.<B><I> </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Applicable
Regulatory Authority</B>&#148; shall mean, in the United States, the Federal Communications Commission (the &#147;<B>FCC</B>&#148;) or comparable national, territorial, regional, state, provincial or local regulatory bodies of competent
jurisdictions and in geographic regions other than the United States from, to or in which the Services are provided, comparable national, territorial, regional, state, provincial or local regulatory authorities. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Application Server(s)</B>&#148; shall mean Wintel Servers, AIX Servers, LINUX Servers, UNIX Servers, and AS/400 Servers. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Applications Software</B>&#148; or &#147;<B>Applications</B>&#148; shall mean Software that is used to support day-to-day business operations
and accomplish specific business objectives. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>ARC Rate</B>&#148; means, in relation to each Billable Resource Unit, the amount
specified as the &#147;ARC Rate&#148; for that Billable Resource Unit on the applicable Supplement, as adjusted pursuant to the applicable Supplement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B>&#147;<B>Asset Inventory and Management System</B>&#148; shall mean an electronic, database-driven application used to store, query, and frequently update asset inventory information for all assets
used in association with the Services, whether the assets are located at Kraft Sites or Supplier Facilities.<B> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>At Risk
Amount</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in the applicable Supplement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Audit Period</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in
<B><U>Section&nbsp;9.10.1</U></B>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Authorized Users</B>&#148; shall mean users of Services within and outside of Kraft including,
but not limited to, Kraft employees, vendors, customers and contractors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Availability</B>&#148; shall mean the Actual Uptime
expressed as a percentage of the Scheduled Uptime for a particular System, Application, Software, Equipment, Network, or any other part of the Services (i.e. Availability % = ((Actual Uptime)/(Scheduled Uptime)) x 100%). Where Systems are redundant,
the outage of one System will not be counted against Availability provided service is not disrupted. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Bankruptcy Code</B>&#148; shall
have the meaning given in <B><U>Section&nbsp;20.6.2</U></B>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Bankruptcy Rejection</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in
<B><U>Section&nbsp;20.6.2</U></B>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Baseline FTEs</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <B><U>Section&nbsp;4.6.1.1</U></B>.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Benchmark Standard</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <B><U>Section&nbsp;11.10.3</U></B>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Benchmarker</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <B><U>Section&nbsp;11.10.1</U></B>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Benchmarking</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <B><U>Section&nbsp;11.10.1</U></B>. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT HAS BEEN REQUESTED FOR PORTIONS OF THIS EXHIBIT. THE COPY FILED HEREWITH OMITS THE INFORMATION SUBJECT TO A
CONFIDENTIALITY REQUEST. OMISSIONS ARE DESIGNATED [ * * * ]. A COMPLETE VERSION OF THIS EXHIBIT HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION. </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Billable Resource Unit</B>&#148; means, in relation to each Resource Unit that is requested or
approved by Kraft or is generated by Kraft&#146;s business activity and identified as a &#147;Billable Resource Unit&#148; on the applicable Supplement, for which distinct charging rates or other charging mechanisms apply. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Brazilian Affected Personnel</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <B><U>Section&nbsp;8.1.1.6.2</U></B>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Business Continuity (Services)</B>&#148; shall mean the overall, company-wide plans and activities that are intended to enable continued
business operation in the event of any unforeseen interruption. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Cable Plant</B>&#148; in all forms whether capitalized or not shall
mean the physical Cables and Wires that make up the Network infrastructure. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Cabling</B>&#148; or &#147;<B>Cable</B>&#148; shall mean
cables that come with ends that permit the physical connection between Equipment and a wall jack or patch panel, including physical cabling media, peripheral cabling used to interconnect electronic equipment and all terminating hardware and cross
connect fields, but not including conduits and pathways. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Calls</B>&#148; shall mean the problems, questions, or requests submitted
to the Supplier by telephone, electronically, or other means approved by Kraft. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Cause</B>&#148; shall mean (i)&nbsp;material breach
of any agreement entered into between the employee and Supplier; (ii)&nbsp;material misconduct; (iii)&nbsp;material or repeated failure to follow Supplier&#146;s policies, directives or orders applicable to Supplier employees holding comparable
positions; (iv)&nbsp;intentional destruction or theft of Supplier property or falsification of Supplier documents; (v)&nbsp;material or repeated failure or refusal to faithfully, diligently, and competently perform the usual and customary duties
associated with your position; (vi)&nbsp;conviction of a felony or any crime involving moral turpitude; or (vii)&nbsp;material or repeated violation of the Supplier Code of Business Conduct. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>CEEMA Core Authorized Users</B>&#148; shall mean users of CEEMA Core Services within a CEEMA Core Location including, but not limited to, Kraft employees, vendors, customers and contractors.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>CEEMA Core Equipment</B>&#148; shall mean all computing, networking, communications and related computing equipment (hardware and
firmware) procured, provided, operated, supported, or used by Kraft, Supplier or Authorized Users in connection with the delivery of CEEMA Core Services, including (i)&nbsp;mainframe, midrange, server and distributed computing equipment and
associated attachments, features, accessories, peripheral devices, and cabling, (ii)&nbsp;personal computers, laptop computers, terminals, workstations and associated attachments, features, accessories, printers, multi-functional printers,
peripheral devices, and cabling, utilized by Supplier, its employees, contractors and consultants and (iii)&nbsp;voice (VOIP), data, and wireless telecommunications and network and monitoring equipment and associated attachments, features,
accessories, peripheral devices, and cabling. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>CEEMA Core Location</B>&#148; shall mean a Kraft Site in CEEMA that is designated in
<B><U>Schedule 7</U></B> or <B><U>7.1</U> or </B>the applicable Supplement as receiving only CEEMA Core Services from the Supplier. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>CEEMA Core Server(s)</B>&#148; shall mean all Wintel Servers, AIX Servers, LINUX Servers, UNIX Servers, and AS/400 Servers located in
Supplier&#146;s Facilities, and all Servers supporting Kraft&#146;s electronic messaging environment (e.g. Exchange) and Servers providing Active Directory, DNS, DHCP&nbsp;&amp; WINS capabilities to Kraft that are located in a CEEMA Core Location.
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>CEEMA Core Services</B>&#148; shall mean, collectively: (i)&nbsp;the services, functions and
responsibilities provided by Supplier in Support of CEEMA Core Equipment and Cross Functional Services as described in the applicable Supplement for the delivery of Services to CEEMA Core Locations including specifically identified CEEMA Core
Transition Services and Transformation; as they may be supplemented, enhanced, modified or replaced during the Term in accordance with the Agreement; (ii)&nbsp;any ongoing Projects required to be performed as specifically described in this Agreement
and any new Projects upon Kraft&#146;s acceptance of Supplier&#146;s proposals for such Projects in accordance with <B><U>Section&nbsp;4.6</U></B> and the other provisions of this Agreement; and (iii)&nbsp;any New Services to be provided at CEEMA
Core Locations, upon Kraft&#146;s acceptance of Supplier&#146;s proposal for such New Services in accordance with <B><U>Section&nbsp;11.5</U></B> and the other provisions of this Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, when the phrase &#147;utilizing
Kraft global processes&#148; is used in the applicable Supplement, Supplier will provide the Service for CEEMA Core Locations using the same processes and tools that exist and are used to provide the Services to Kraft under the Agreement. Unless
otherwise specified, Supplier will not be required to create unique processes or tools for CEEMA Core Services. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>CEEMA Core
Software</B>&#148; shall mean all software programs and programming (and all modifications, replacements, Upgrades, enhancements, documentation, materials and media related thereto), to the extent that Supplier has financial or operational
responsibility for such programs or programming in connection with the provision of CEEMA Core Services, in accordance with <B><U>Schedule 11.1</U></B>, <B><U>12.1</U></B> or <B><U>12.3</U></B> or the applicable Supplement. CEEMA Core Software also
shall include all such programs or programming in use or required to be used, developed and/or introduced by or for Kraft or the Eligible Recipients for Core Services on or after the CEEMA Core Services Commencement Date to the extent Supplier has
financial or operational responsibility for such programs or programming under <B><U>Schedule 11.1</U></B>, <B><U>12.1</U></B> or <B><U>12.3</U></B> or the applicable Supplement. CEEMA Core Software includes all Applications, Development Tools,
Management Tools and Systems Software that is installed on CEEMA Core Equipment, or utilized by Supplier to provide CEEMA Core Services. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Change Control Procedures</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <B><U>Section&nbsp;9.6.1</U></B>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Charges</B>&#148; shall mean the amounts set forth in <B><U>Article 11</U></B> and the applicable Supplement (or otherwise set forth in the
Agreement) as charges due to the Supplier in return for providing the Services, including the applicable taxes payable under <B><U>Section&nbsp;11.4</U></B>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Collaborative Applications</B>&#148; shall mean Applications containing functionality to enable electronic communication and messaging, work group collaboration, information transfers, frequently
asked questions, and similar Applications that allow collaborative interaction and receipt/transfer of data and information both within and outside of Kraft. Examples of current and/or future Collaborative Applications include electronic mail,
calendaring, and instant messaging. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Commencement Date</B>&#148; means the applicable Supplement Commencement Date for the particular
Services as designated in the applicable Supplement. For Supplement A to this Agreement, the Commencement Date shall mean the commencement date for Supplement A under the Legacy Agreement, regardless whether such date is prior to the GroceryCo Start
Date. For other Services under this Agreement that are not covered by a Supplement and which were previously provided under the Legacy Agreement (and are made part of the Services pursuant to the terms of the Spin-Off Amendment), the Commencement
Date shall mean the commencement date of the Legacy Agreement, regardless whether such date is prior to the GroceryCo Start Date. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT HAS BEEN REQUESTED FOR PORTIONS OF THIS EXHIBIT. THE COPY FILED HEREWITH OMITS THE INFORMATION SUBJECT TO A
CONFIDENTIALITY REQUEST. OMISSIONS ARE DESIGNATED [ * * * ]. A COMPLETE VERSION OF THIS EXHIBIT HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION. </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Commercial Off The Shelf</B>&#148; or &#147;<B>COTS</B>&#148; shall mean Equipment or Software, as
applicable, that is generally available to the public. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I></I></B>&#147;<B><I></I></B><B>Companion Agreement</B><B><I></I></B>&#148; shall
have the meaning given in <B><I></I></B><B><U>Section 2.3.1</U></B><B>.</B><B><I> </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Compliance</B>&#148; and
&#147;<B>Comply</B>&#148; shall mean, with respect to outsourced business process(es), Software, Equipment, Systems or other contract deliverables to be implemented, designed, developed, delivered, integrated, installed and/or tested by Supplier, in
compliance in all material respects with the Specifications. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Conferencing (Services)</B>&#148; shall mean the provision of audio,
web and video conferencing services for Authorized Users as described in the Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Conferencing Premise Equipment</B>&#148;
shall mean the Equipment, features, accessories, and peripherals supported or used by Supplier in connection with its provision of Conferencing Services to the Authorized Users, including control computers, audio, web and video conferencing bridges,
muxes, multi-point bridging equipment, and associated diagnostic equipment, and all additions, modifications, substitutions, Upgrades or enhancements to such Equipment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Conferencing Premise System</B>&#148; shall mean the Conferencing Premise Equipment and associated Software supported or used by Supplier in connection with its provision of Conferencing
Services. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Connectivity</B>&#148; shall mean the ability to electronically access and exchange data, voice, and/or video electronic
impulses between various infrastructure components and with external sources as approved by Kraft and provided to Authorized Users. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Consumption-Based Resource Unit</B>&#148; means the Billable Resource Units for which Kraft&#146;s charge is calculated on a specific unit of
consumption, and not on a monthly basis, such as FTE hours or telecom minutes usage. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Continuing Legacy Services</B>&#148; means, to
the extent the Parties have not entered into any of the following Supplements pursuant to either this MPSA, as amended as of the GroceryCo Start Date, or the GroceryCo MPSA, by the GroceryCo Start Date, such corresponding Services under the Legacy
Agreement for which a Supplement has not been entered into by the Parties under this Agreement: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>(a) <B>Supplement
G-SnackCo</B></U> (EUC Hardware), </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>(b) <B>Supplement H-SnackCo</B></U> (Network), </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>(c) <B>Supplement I-SnackCo</B></U> (CEEMA Arrow Services), </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>(d) <B>Supplement J-SnackCo</B></U> (Elite Software Agreement), </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>(e)
<B>Supplement B-GroceryCo</B></U> (EUC Hardware), and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>(f) <B>Supplement C-GroceryCo</B></U> (Elite Software Agreement).
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Contract Changes</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <B><U>Section&nbsp;11.1.5</U></B>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Contract Records</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in <B><U>Section&nbsp;9.10.1</U></B>. </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Contract Year</B>&#148; shall mean, for the first Contract Year, a period commencing on the
GroceryCo Start Date and ending on December&nbsp;31 of the same calendar year and, for each ensuing Contract Year, a 12 month period commencing on January&nbsp;1 and ending on December&nbsp;31 (or, if earlier, on the last day of the Term). If any
Contract Year is less than 12 months, the rights and obligations under this Agreement that are calculated on a Contract Year basis will be proportionately adjusted for such shorter period. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Control</B>&#148; and its derivatives shall mean: (a)&nbsp;the legal, beneficial, or equitable ownership, directly or indirectly, of (i)&nbsp;more than 50% of the aggregate of all voting equity
interests in an Entity, or (ii)&nbsp;equity interests having the right, in the event of dissolution, to more than 50% of the assets of an Entity; (b)&nbsp;the right to appoint, directly or indirectly, a majority of the board of directors;
(c)&nbsp;the right to control, directly or indirectly, the management or direction of the Entity by contract or corporate governance document; or (d)&nbsp;in the case of a partnership, the holding by an Entity (or one of its Affiliates) of the
position of sole general partner. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Core Service Commencement Date</B>&#148; shall mean the date in which the Transition to Core
Services is made effective for a particular Kraft country or Core Location. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Course</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in
<B><U>Section&nbsp;8.2.7</U></B>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Critical Affected Personnel</B>&#148; shall mean those individuals identified in the applicable
Supplement as critical to the ongoing success of Supplier&#146;s delivery of information technology services to Kraft and the Eligible Recipients. For those countries where the Critical Affected Personnel are not designated as of the Effective Date,
Kraft shall designate by the Commencement Date (or in the case of such individuals in Deferred Countries, at least by the date that Supplier is required to make offers to those individuals pursuant to <B><U>Section&nbsp;8.1.1.1)</U></B> no more than
fifteen percent (15%)&nbsp;of the Affected Personnel as Critical Affected Personnel, provided that the total number of Critical Affected Personnel who are contractors cannot exceed five percent (5%)&nbsp;of the number of Affected Personnel who are
contractors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Critical Deliverables</B>&#148; shall mean those milestone activities and deliverables identified in the applicable
Supplement that have associated Deliverable Credits payable to Kraft in the event Supplier fails to deliver such deliverables in accordance with the applicable Supplement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Critical Service Level</B>&#148; shall mean those Service Levels established under the applicable Supplement for which a Service Level Credit may be payable. Critical Service Levels are
identified in the applicable Supplement and are described in the applicable Supplement. Each Critical Service Level has an Expected Service Level and a Minimum Service Level associated with it unless otherwise specified. It is the intent of the
Parties that all Critical Service Levels shall be quantifiable, measurable, and objective. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Cross Functional Services&#148;</B> shall
mean those Services described in the applicable Supplement and statement of work as &#147;Cross Functional&#148; Services. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Deferred
Countries</B>&#148; shall mean all countries other than the United States and Canada. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Deliverable Credits</B>&#148; shall have the
meaning given in <B><U>Section&nbsp;7.2.2</U></B>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Derivative Work</B>&#148; shall mean a work based on one or more preexisting
works, including a condensation, transformation, translation, modification, expansion, or adaptation, that, if prepared without authorization of the owner of the copyright of such preexisting work, would constitute a copyright infringement under
applicable Law, but excluding the preexisting work. </FONT></P>

generally and not specifically for Kraft. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Development Tool</B>&#148; shall mean all Software that is used in the development,
testing, deployment and maintenance of Applications. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;[ * * * ]&#148; shall mean the Entities identified in <B><U>Schedule 24.1</U></B>,
as well as their successors and assigns, as such list of Entities may be modified by Kraft from time to time, including any divested portions of companies identified in <B><U>Schedule 24.1</U></B><B><I></I></B><B>. </B>Kraft may add to

<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B>&#147;<B>Disaster Recovery (Services)</B>&#148; shall mean the specific activities related to continued provisioning of the Services in the event
of an unforeseen interruption. Disaster Recovery activities include support and coordination with the Business Continuity Services as described in the Disaster Recovery Plan.<B> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Disaster Recovery Plan</B>&#148; shall mean the plan for recovering data, systems and services in the event of a disaster and for continuing the performance of the Services. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Downtime</B>&#148; shall mean the period of time that a particular System, Application, Software, Equipment, Network, or any other part of the
Services is not available during the Measurement Window. During a switchover, the architected switchover time will not be counted towards Downtime; however, the Downtime encountered prior to making the decision to cut over will be counted against
Availability. Maintenance Downtime shall not be counted towards Downtime. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>DSD Device</B>&#148; shall have the meaning given in the
applicable Supplement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B>&#147;<B>Earnback</B>&#148; shall mean the methodology used to determine the potential elimination of a Service
Level Credit as described in the applicable Supplement.<B> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>ECS Services</B>&#148; shall mean enterprise cloud services offered
by Supplier, which if included under this Agreement shall be subject to its own Supplement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>EDS</B>&#148; means &#147;HP Enterprise
Services, LLC&#148;. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Effective Date</B>&#148; shall mean Supplement Effective Date for the applicable Supplement, except with
respect to the <B><U>Preamble</U></B>, <B><U>Sections 3.1</U></B>, <B><U>9.5.1</U></B>, <B><U>9.5.2</U></B>, <B><U>15.5.1</U></B>, <B><U>17.1.5</U></B> and the &#147;IN WITNESS WHEREOF&#148; clause at the end of the MPSA where Effective Date shall
mean the Effective Date of the MPSA. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B>Eligible Recipients</B>&#148; shall mean, collectively, and to the extent such Entity is
